resources.string: Error loading models for internal storage
Error loading files for external storage
Folder where the files are found not defined
No dataset was loaded. The datasets.yaml file must be empty or malformed
No model was loaded. The models.yaml file must be empty or malformed
Permission to read internal storage not granted
To use this function, the app needs permission to read the files
This app\'s main objective is to benchmark artificial intelligence models focused on computer vision on Android smartphones. It evaluates tasks such as classification, detection, and segmentation.
GPU usage is monitored through specific system files: /sys/kernel/gpu/gpu_busy for Mali GPUs and /sys/class/kgsl/kgsl-3d0/gpubusy for Adreno GPUs.

To measure RAM usage, the app uses the PSS (Proportional Set Size) value, which accounts for both the memory used solely by the process and the memory shared with other processes, but only in proportion to the number of processes using it.
Why doesn\'t the app measure CPU usage?

Since Android 8.0, the operating system has restricted access to the /proc file during the app\'s runtime. This file was used, among other things, to obtain the CPU usage percentage. Due to these restrictions, it is not possible to capture the CPU usage percentage in the release version of the app, only in the debug version.

Lux.AI is a project developed at the Center for Informatics at UFPE, as part of the PPI (Priority Programs and Projects of the IT Law), with support from the Ministry of Science, Technology, Innovations, and Communications, through the IT Law (Law No. 8.248/91) and the SOFTEX Program.

Lux.AI’s main areas of study and development include:

1. Computational Photography
2. Artificial Intelligence
3. Image Quality Analysis
4. Performance Analysis of Heterogeneous Systems.

Lux.AI develops mobile applications with AI-based functionalities and applies techniques such as training, fine-tuning, pruning, and other performance optimization methods for AI models.

Additionally, it offers consulting and personalized services to the industry, covering everything from AI model training and fine-tuning to performance improvement on restrictive hardware.
To allow the execution of TFLite models in the phone storage, we need access to the phone’s internal storage.
How to run the benchmarking with custom models

If you want to run the benchmarking with custom models, you should allow the app access to the phone\'s internal storage. Then, move the custom models to the Speed.AI folder in the phone\'s file system.\n\nIf you don\'t allow the access, you will still be able to continue with the default models.
Continue with only the default models
